member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.CertificateForwardingBuilderExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for using certificate forwarding.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.CertificateForwardingBuilderExtensions.UseCertificateForwarding(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.IApplicationBuilder)
member.summary: Adds a middleware to the pipeline that will look for a certificate in a request header decode it, and updates HttpContext.Connection.ClientCertificate.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.ForwardedHeadersExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for enabling .

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.ForwardedHeadersExtensions.UseForwardedHeaders(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.IApplicationBuilder)
member.summary:
Applies forwarded headers to their matching fields on the current request.
By convention, HTTP proxies forward information from the client in well-known HTTP headers. The reads these headers and fills in the associated fields on HttpContext.
member.returns: A reference to after the operation has completed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.ForwardedHeadersExtensions.UseForwardedHeaders(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.IApplicationBuilder,Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.ForwardedHeadersOptions)
member.summary:
Applies forwarded headers to their matching fields on the current request.
By convention, HTTP proxies forward information from the client in well-known HTTP headers. The reads these headers and fills in the associated fields on HttpContext.
member.returns: A reference to after the operation has completed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.ForwardedHeadersOptions
member.summary: Options for

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.ForwardedHeadersOptions.ForwardedForHeaderName
member.summary: Gets or sets the header used to retrieve the originating client IP. Defaults to the value specified by .

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.ForwardedHeadersOptions.ForwardedHostHeaderName
member.summary: Gets or sets the header used to retrieve the original value of the Host header field. Defaults to the value specified by

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.ForwardedHeadersOptions.ForwardedProtoHeaderName
member.summary: Gets or sets the header used to retrieve the value for the originating scheme (HTTP/HTTPS). Defaults to the value specified by

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.ForwardedHeadersOptions.OriginalForHeaderName
member.summary: Gets or sets the header used to store the original value of client IP before applying forwarded headers. Defaults to the value specified by

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.ForwardedHeadersOptions.OriginalHostHeaderName
member.summary: Gets or sets the header used to store the original value of the Host header field before applying forwarded headers. Defaults to the value specified by

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.ForwardedHeadersOptions.OriginalProtoHeaderName
member.summary: Gets or sets the header used to store the original scheme (HTTP/HTTPS) before applying forwarded headers. Defaults to the value specified by

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.ForwardedHeadersOptions.ForwardedHeaders
member.summary: Identifies which forwarders should be processed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.ForwardedHeadersOptions.ForwardLimit
member.summary: Limits the number of entries in the headers that will be processed. The default value is 1. Set to null to disable the limit, but this should only be done if KnownProxies or KnownNetworks are configured.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.ForwardedHeadersOptions.KnownProxies
member.summary: Addresses of known proxies to accept forwarded headers from.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.ForwardedHeadersOptions.KnownNetworks
member.summary: Address ranges of known proxies to accept forwarded headers from.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.ForwardedHeadersOptions.AllowedHosts
member.summary: The allowed values from x-forwarded-host. If the list is empty then all hosts are allowed. Failing to restrict this these values may allow an attacker to spoof links generated by your service.

item.description: A top level wildcard "*" allows all non-empty hosts.
Subdomain wildcards are permitted. E.g. "*.example.com" matches subdomains like foo.example.com, but not the parent domain example.com.
Unicode host names are allowed but will be converted to punycode for matching.
IPv6 addresses must include their bounding brackets and be in their normalized form.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.ForwardedHeadersOptions.RequireHeaderSymmetry
member.summary: Require the number of header values to be in sync between the different headers being processed. The default is 'false'.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.HttpMethodOverrideExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for enabling .

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.HttpMethodOverrideExtensions.UseHttpMethodOverride(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.IApplicationBuilder)
member.summary: Allows incoming POST request to override method type with type specified in header. This middleware is used when a client is limited to sending GET or POST methods but wants to invoke other HTTP methods. By default, the X-HTTP-Method-Override request header is used to specify the HTTP method being tunneled.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.HttpMethodOverrideExtensions.UseHttpMethodOverride(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.IApplicationBuilder,Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.HttpMethodOverrideOptions)
member.summary: Allows incoming POST request to override method type with type specified in form. This middleware is used when a client is limited to sending GET or POST methods but wants to invoke other HTTP methods.
member.param: The which indicates which form type specifies the override method.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.HttpMethodOverrideOptions
member.summary: Options for configuring

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.HttpMethodOverrideOptions.FormFieldName
member.summary: Denotes the form element that contains the name of the resulting method type. If not set the X-Http-Method-Override header will be used.

member.summary: Do not process any forwarders

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpOverrides.ForwardedHeaders.XForwardedHost
member.summary: Process X-Forwarded-Host, which identifies the original host requested by the client.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpOverrides.ForwardedHeaders.XForwardedProto
member.summary: Process X-Forwarded-Proto, which identifies the protocol (HTTP or HTTPS) the client used to connect.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpOverrides.ForwardedHeaders.All
member.summary: Process X-Forwarded-For, X-Forwarded-Host and X-Forwarded-Proto.
